item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Although a skillful flatterer is a most delightful companion if you have him all to yourself, his taste becomes very doubtful when he takes to complimenting other people." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "You may be an undigested bit of beef, a blot of mustard, a crumb of cheese, a fragment of underdone potato. There's more of gravy than of grave about you, whatever you are!" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "We need never be ashamed of our tears." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description: "…everything has a past. Everything – a person, an object, a word, everything. If you don’t know the past, you can’t understand the present and plan properly for the future." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description:
"Human beings do not live forever, Reuven. We live less than the time it takes to blink an eye, if we measure our lives against eternity. So it may be asked what value is there to a human life. There is so much pain in the world. What does it mean to have to suffer so much if our lives are nothing more than the blink of an eye?
I learned a long time ago, Reuven, that a blink of an eye in itself is nothing. But the eye that blinks, that is something. A span of life is nothing. But the man who lives that span, he is something. He can fill that tiny span with meaning, so its quality is immeasurable though its quantity may be insignificant. Do you understand what I am saying? A man must fill his life with meaning, meaning is not automatically given to life.
It is hard work to fill one's life with meaning. That I do not think you understand yet. A life filled with meaning is worthy of rest. I want to be worthy of rest when I am no longer here." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Be grateful, be smart, be clean, be true, be humble, be prayerful." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "I came from a real tough neighborhood. Why, every time I shut the window I hurt somebody's fingers." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Phyllis Diller
item.description: "Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight." -- Phyllis Diller

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Thomas Szasz
item.description: "Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse." -- Thomas Szasz

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor
